page.title: 17THE SQUARE
page.content: { THE SQUARE} The village of St. Keverne lies one mile inland from Porthoustock on the east coast of the Lizard peninsula. In the centre of the large village square there is a granite cross which commenorates deaths in the first and second World Wars. The church tower is 60 feet tall and the spire is another 40 feet. The church is such an important landmark for ships to warn them of the deadly Manacle rocks that when the steeple was destroyed by lightning in 1770 it was quickly replaced. The shops in the square consist of a post office, a butcher, a grocer and a gift shop. There are two pubs, the Three Tuns and the White Hart. Around the memorial there are parking spaces. There is a garage, a telephone box and a bus shelter. All these form the 4 sides of the square.
